events.title: First Fleet Arrives in Australia
events.description: The First Fleet, carrying convicts and settlers, arrived at Botany Bay, marking the beginning of British colonization in Australia.
events.significance: This event is considered the founding of modern Australia and is commemorated as Australia Day.

events.title: Michigan Becomes the 26th U.S. State
events.description: Michigan was admitted to the United States as the 26th state, following its settlement and development.
events.significance: This expanded the United States and contributed to its westward growth during the 19th century.

events.title: Indian Independence Movement: Pledge of Purna Swaraj
events.description: The Indian National Congress declared January 26 as the day for complete independence (Purna Swaraj) from British rule.
events.significance: This declaration was a pivotal moment in the Indian independence movement, eventually leading to India's freedom in 1947.

events.title: India Becomes a Republic
events.description: The Constitution of India came into effect, and India was declared a sovereign republic.
events.significance: This marked the official transition of India to a republic, with a president as its head of state, and is celebrated annually as Republic Day.

events.title: Sir Winston Churchill Dies
events.description: Winston Churchill, former Prime Minister of the United Kingdom, died at the age of 90.
events.significance: Churchill was a significant leader during World War II and his death marked the end of an era in British politics.
